numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Legacy applicants have a higher chance of getting into top-tier colleges than non-legacy students.
3. If a student's parents are wealthy, then the student is more likely to get into a top-tier college.
4. I wonder why legacy students have a greater chance of getting into top-tier colleges than non-legacy students.
5. I wonder why a parent's income affects a student's chance of getting into a college.
6. There is a dip in the number of students who have no legacy.
7. I wonder why there is a dip in the number of students who have no legacy.
8. This situation relates to my community.
9. In my community, college admission depends on a parent's income.
10. In my community, college admission depends on whether a parent attended the college.
11. In my community, college admission does not depend only on a student's success.
12. In my community, college admission does not depend only on a student's test scores.
13. The headline is: legacy or no legacy.
